greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T[n,m] = number of solid partitions of n with trace m, where the trace of a solid partitions is defined as the sum of the traces of the constituent plane partitions.
comment: Last column equals the partition numbers, corresponding to the 'single column' solid partitions.
formula: Finding a GF for the solid partitions is an open problem.
example: T[4,3]=6 since these 6 solid partitions with trace 3 are:
mathematica: uses functions defined in A090984, A089924. solidform[q_?PartitionQ]:=Module[{}, Select[Flatten[Outer[z, Sequence@@(planepartitions/@q), 1]], And@@Apply[coversplaneQ, Partition[ #/.z->List, 2, 1], {1}]&]];tomatrix[par_]:=Block[{l=Max[Length/@ par]}, Map[PadRight[ #, l]&, par]]; Table[Length/@Split[Sort[Plus@@@Map[Tr[tomatrix[ # ]]&, Flatten[solidform/ @Partitions[n]], {2}]]], {n, 12}]
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Jun 05 2004
